channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Stemming flow of weapons to Mexico is joint operation's 'No. 1 priority,' feds say
item.description: A table full of seized guns, pistols and other firearms were displayed for media on Thursday in this border town to show off the spoils of a federal joint operation that officials say is proving successful in stopping weapons from going from the United States to Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Sandra Sanchez, NewsNation

item.title: Paris bans electric scooters after series of accidents
item.description: Paris on Friday became the first European capital to introduce a ban on self-service rented electric scooters after five years of concerns surrounding their safety and environmental impact.
item.dc:creator: Tiah Shepherd, The Hill

item.title: Paris bans electric scooters after series of accidents
item.description: Paris on Friday became the first European capital to introduce a ban on self-service rented electric scooters after five years of concerns surrounding their safety and environmental impact.
item.dc:creator: Tiah Shepherd, The Hill

item.title: 9 soldiers dead in Syria as attacks by al-Qaida-linked militants rise in the Northwest, activists say
item.description: Al-Qaida-linked Hayat Tahrir al-Sham militants in northwest Syria were responsible for Friday’s attack that left nine soldiers dead, according to opposition activists.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 9 soldiers dead in Syria as attacks by al-Qaida-linked militants rise in the Northwest, activists say
item.description: Al-Qaida-linked Hayat Tahrir al-Sham militants in northwest Syria were responsible for Friday’s attack that left nine soldiers dead, according to opposition activists.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia’s students return to school, face new patriotism-boosting lessons as Kremlin continues war in Ukraine
item.description: Students in Russia are returning to school and will face new teachings meant to raise their loyalty to the Kremlin, as Russia continues its conflict with the West and Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia’s students return to school, face new patriotism-boosting lessons as Kremlin continues war in Ukraine
item.description: Students in Russia are returning to school and will face new teachings meant to raise their loyalty to the Kremlin, as Russia continues its conflict with the West and Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Death toll from Johannesburg fire rises to 76 as city turns to tough job of identifying victims
item.description: JOHANNESBURG (AP) — Search teams finished checking a derelict Johannesburg apartment building a day after one of South Africa's deadliest fires broke out there as pathologists faced the grisly task Friday of identifying charred bodies and body parts that were transported in large trucks to mortuarie
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY and MOGOMOTSI MAGOME, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Gabon opposition leader alleges the ousted president's family arranged the coup to retain power
item.description: DAKAR, Senegal (AP) — Gabon’s opposition leader accused the family of the recently ousted president of engineering his removal from power in order to retain their control in the oil-rich Central African nation, and said Friday that he should have won last week's presidential election.
item.dc:creator: SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Over 2,000 Russian troops take part in military exercises in Belarus near borders of NATO countries
item.description: Russian troops took part in military exercises in Belarus. The exercises took place near the borders of NATO countries. They are meant to prepare for joint operations.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Putin, Erdoğan to meet in wake of Moscow's withdrawal from Ukraine grain deal
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan are set to meet for talks in Sochi, Russia, next week, amid efforts to bring Moscow back into an agreement allowing for the continued export of Ukrainian goods despite the war.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Wagner Group flag seen flying at Prigozhin crash site in Russia
item.description: A flag and makeshift memorial have appeared at the site outside of Moscow, Russia, where Wagner Group founder Yevgeny Prigozhin died in a plane crash.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Russia's Putin and Turkey's Erdogan set to meet amid efforts to repair Ukraine grain deal
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will host Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan for talks next week, the Kremlin announced Friday, just over six weeks after Moscow broke off a deal brokered by Ankara and the U.N. that allowed Ukrainian grain to reach world markets safely despite the 18-month war.
item.dc:creator: AP, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: 18 suspected gang members killed in South African police shootout
item.description: At least 18 suspected gang members were killed in a shootout with South African police. The suspects allegedly were robbing armored vans carrying cash.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Anger in Sweden as Nobel Prize organizers invite Russia and Belarus to the award ceremonies
item.description: STOCKHOLM (AP) — Several Swedish lawmakers said Friday they will boycott this year's Nobel Prize award ceremonies after the private foundation that administers the prestigious awards changed its position from a year earlier and invited representatives of Russia, Belarus and Iran to attend.
item.dc:creator: DAVID KEYTON, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Thailand's king reduces former Prime Minister Thaksin's 8-year prison term to a single year
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — Thailand’s king on Friday reduced former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra's eight-year prison term to a single year following the divisive politician's return last week from 15 years of self-imposed exile.
item.dc:creator: GRANT PECK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Special visa program for Afghans faces ongoing challenges after US withdrawal: watchdog
item.description: The special visa program to get Afghan citizens who assisted the American military into the U.S. faces lingering challenges despite years of reviews and oversight, according to a report from the State Department Inspector General.
item.dc:creator: Nick Robertson, The Hill

item.title: It's joy mixed with sorrow as Ukrainian children go back to school in the midst of war
item.description: An atmosphere of joy mixed with sorrow sets the tone for the start of the new school year in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Hanna Arhirova, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Shooting of a brown bear leaves 2 cubs motherless and sparks outrage in Italy
item.description: ROME (AP) — The slaying of an endangered brown bear near an Italian national park left her two young cubs motherless and sparked outrage in Italy on Friday.
item.dc:creator: FRANCES D'EMILIO, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Ukraine has developed long-range weapon, Zelensky says
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced Thursday that his country has developed a long-range weapon that can hit targets up to 400 miles away, signaling potential responsibility for a strike on a Russian airport near Estonia on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Nick Robertson, The Hill

item.title: Israeli forces raid a West Bank town, sparking a firefight that kills a Palestinian teacher
item.description: Palestinian health officials say that the Israeli military has raided a Palestinian town in the northern West Bank, besieging an apartment and sparking a gunfight with local militants that killed an apparently uninvolved Palestinian teacher.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Debre, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Israeli forces raid a West Bank town, sparking a firefight that kills a Palestinian teacher
item.description: Palestinian health officials say that the Israeli military has raided a Palestinian town in the northern West Bank, besieging an apartment and sparking a gunfight with local militants that killed an apparently uninvolved Palestinian teacher.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Debre, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Ramaswamy isolates himself on Ukraine with proposed Putin pact
item.description: When the Fox News hosts asked the eight Republican presidential candidates on the debate stage last week who would not support continued funding for Ukraine, only Vivek Ramaswamy raised his hand.
item.dc:creator: Brad Dress, The Hill

item.title: Ramaswamy isolates himself on Ukraine with proposed Putin pact
item.description: When the Fox News hosts asked the eight Republican presidential candidates on the debate stage last week who would not support continued funding for Ukraine, only Vivek Ramaswamy raised his hand.
item.dc:creator: Brad Dress, The Hill

item.title: Mutineers in Gabon appoint a military leader after detaining the president, alleging corruption
item.description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon (AP) — Mutinous soldiers in Gabon proclaimed their republican guard chief as the country’s leader Wednesday after placing the just-reelected President Ali Bongo Ondimba under house arrest, alleging betrayal and massive embezzlement during his long-time rule over the oil-rich Centra
item.dc:creator: YVES LAURENT GOMA and SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Ukrainian drones strike deep in Russian territory, Moscow says, while a barrage in Kyiv kills 2
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine sent waves of drones deep into western Russia in more than four hours of nighttime attacks that struck military assets, Russian officials and media reports said Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: SUSIE BLANN and DASHA LITVINOVA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Canada warns residents visiting US about anti-LGBTQ laws
item.description: The Canadian government said LGBTQ Canadians considering a trip to the U.S. should “check relevant state and local laws” before visiting.
item.dc:creator: Brooke Migdon, NewsNation

item.title: Japanese ministers eat Fukushima fish to show it's safe after nuclear plant wastewater is discharged
item.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and three Cabinet ministers ate Fukushima fish sashimi at a lunch meeting Wednesday, in an apparent effort to show that fish is safe following the release of treated radioactive wastewater from the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant that began las
item.dc:creator: MARI YAMAGUCHI, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: White House says Putin and Kim Jong Un traded letters as Russia looks for munitions from North Korea
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The White House on Wednesday said that it has new intelligence that shows Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un have swapped letters as Russia looks to North Korea for munitions for the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin is buried in private, ending his tumultuous journey
item.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia (AP) — A private burial was held for Yevgeny Prigozhin, ending a tumultuous journey from St.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin is buried in private, ending his tumultuous journey
item.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia (AP) — A private burial was held for Yevgeny Prigozhin, ending a tumultuous journey from St.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Neurosurgeon investigating patient's mystery symptoms plucks worm from woman's brain
item.description: A neurosurgeon investigating a woman’s mystery symptoms in an Australian hospital says she plucked a wriggling worm from the patient’s brain.
item.dc:creator: ROD McGUIRK Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: US Marines killed in Australian aircraft crash were from Illinois, Virginia and Colorado
item.description: CANBERRA, Australia (AP) — The three U.S. Marines killed in a tiltrotor aircraft crash during a training exercise in Australia were from Illinois, Virginia and Colorado and another Marine was in critical condition, the Marine Corps said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: US, Chinese commerce leaders meet: 'Huge progress'
item.description: Following a meeting in Beijing Monday, commerce leaders promised to improve communication between the United States and China, a signal that tensions could be easing.
item.dc:creator: Raquel Martin, WGN 9

item.title: British bog snorkeling championship contenders race through slime
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: British bog snorkeling championship contenders race through slime
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: With drones and webcams, volunteer hunters join new search for mythical Loch Ness Monster
item.description: Mystery hunters converged on a Scottish lake on Saturday to look for signs of the mythical Loch Ness Monster.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless, WFLA, NBC
